column5: Well, I am a couple of weeks late but we'll all get over it, I'm sure.  Barbara and I and our grandson Brent spent a great week on the West Arm, West Bay actually, at Memquisit Lodge with Lew, Diane and daughter Sherri, Pete (Squid) and his wife Sue, Jim, Susan, Corey and Ben from Misty Cove fame and a member of our Southern buddies Dustin (Bubba). We probably picked the best week of the summer so far, weather wise.  Barbara & I met Bubba at BPS bright and early, well it was early and Barbara & I were pretty bright but Bubba was showing the weary signs of a straight through drive from Tennessee. Figured we had better get some calories into him so we stopped for breakfast, gas and then headed up 69.  Memquisit is a nice place, view across the water from our cabin was second to none. Most of the cabins are boat to, meaning you need to load your stuff for the week in the boat at the dock and then unload at the cabin. Lugging the stuff up the rocks gets the heart rate up for sure.  Fishing was great, catching was tough most of the week. Even the typical 20"-30" Nipissing pike were not co-operating. The odd day would bring the odd Walleye and smallie, but the elusive West Arm Muskie.........not even a follow or a swirl. Until, later in the week they seemed to turn on a little. Still nothing like I have seen it, but I got a 39", Pete got a 49" and Jim got I believe a 44".  Wonderful time with great people. Have booked for next year already...
Dang, I will have to get the video working later
Video works fine! Great report and super pics John! Glad you had a good time...it looks wonderful!
Nice place, you guys should really try and relax a bit on your vacations. OFC verification required folks. There appears to be a smile on Lews face
Nice, love that video and the Musky shot!
Beauty John ! Wish we could have dropped down for a day.  Now were'd you find Lew's slithering friend....
Sweeeeeeet!!  I love the west arm..  cheers HD
Great times John.  I'm already looking forward to coming back up there next year.   I know there's a big girl up there with my name on her.

He was our cabin mate for the week Wayne. We were on a rocky point just across a small bay from the others. There were 4 of them that laid on the rocks most of the day, but he was the daddy. Brent was feeding them night crawlers........
Excellent report and pics John!!!  Well worth the wait!     This pic says it all!... I guess hanging out with the Lew and Pete guys rubbed off on ya eh!!!
I like that, one happy angler. Captures what the trip's all about in one shot.
